Comments
Our campus police is always accessible.
-The Greek life is amazing on campus. -You aren't treated any differently on campus if you aren't apart of sorority or a frat. -We have a Greek walk and there are plenty of soro & frat activities
There's a various amount of activities. Simply visit the website to look: http://nsu.edu
-social -one that's loving of HBCU's
There aren't any that I can think of.
It's more than worth it, the only thing that's overpriced is the student bookstore.
On campus there's a moderate amount of things to do for fun, but a good amount of the students go to clubs.
The Cafeterias always have great food, and our student center has Tropical Smoothie, Pizza Hut, & Chick Fil A.
Dorm life is very nice at NSU; it's very well regulated and incredibly social.
Academically NSU makes it very easy for you to prosper, and our professors are very supporitve.
Stay on the administration about anything you do & make copies of papers you give them.
NSU is an amazing college. Our staff is very friendly and they make you feel very much at home. The only thing that they could seriously improve is lack of administration.
pageTitle: Norfolk State University (NSU) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {405511=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 175383=Brown hall is the oldest building on campus, has been here since about 1935., 145354=Athletic- Basketball, Baseball, Football, Bowling, Tennis, etc. (NSU held 5 MEAC titles in 2011-2012), 30719=i like the pass and review that the marching band does during the home games. although they play a lot of old school music, their marching style differs from other schools because they march military style and this is refreshing from other college bands. i wish they could get enough votes to attend the honda battle of the college bands so people in other areas can see them., 342182=Depends on where and when you go. Everything revolves and around meal plan, which happens three times a day: 730-930, 11-130, and 430 - 730 during the weekday, and 1030-130 and 430-630 on the weekends. You have the big cafÃ© and small cafÃ© (close from Friday evening -sun), the small cafÃ©, the student center (chic-fil-a, tropical smoothie, and pizza hut), Spartan Station (burgers, burritos, and subs) and the Bodega which doesn't have meal plan, but is perfect for late night dining when you have dining dollars have Spartan bucks. After awhile it gets old and you'll be begging your parents for money to eat off campus.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Kanisha from Waverly, VA 12/14/2009 Reviewer is Accepted here and planning to attend soon. Reviewer has been to campus. 9 out of 10 people found this review useful. 3 of 103 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Outgoing, Successful, Friendly, Positive, Motivating, and VERY open minded Tips for prospective students Be prepared for a AWESOME excperience at NSU. Apply for your classes and housing early so u will have a better chance to get your stuff together. Bang for the buck Its a GREAT college and not so expensive. I get more education and activities for my money and i LOVE it. Will enjoy being here I already enjoy the campus and i dont even live there yet. The students and staff is so friendly. Will learn a lot
